compression.title: Step 2: Compression Settings
compression.batchEnableMessage: Please upload images first to enable batch compression
compression.qualityModeDescription: Reduce file size by lowering image quality. Lower quality means higher compression, but images may appear blurred or distorted. If the original image already has low quality, the compressed file might become larger.
compression.sizeModeDescription: Specify target file size, system will automatically adjust quality and dimensions to reach the target. More precise control over file size, suitable for scenarios with specific size requirements.
compression.targetSizeHint: Recommended range: 50-2000KB, depending on image usage and quality requirements
compression.qualityVeryHigh: Very High Quality - Slight compression, minimal file size change
compression.qualityHigh: High Quality - Recommended setting, balanced quality and size
compression.qualityMedium: Medium Quality - Noticeable compression, suitable for web
compression.qualityLow: Low Quality - Heavy compression, possible distortion
compression.qualityVeryLow: Very Low Quality - Extreme compression, obvious distortion
compression.smartCompressionDescription: System will automatically detect compression effectiveness. If quality compression results in larger files, it will automatically try size adjustment to ensure file size reduction.
compression.compressionStrategyDescription: System will first try quality compression. If target size is not reached, it will automatically reduce dimensions until requirements are met.
compression.formatHints: JPEG: Smallest file size | PNG: Supports transparency | WebP: Best for modern browsers
compression.enableMessage: Please upload an image first to enable compression settings
